title: Olympic National Park: How Long Will Litter Last
body: How Long Will Litter Last?                     Decomposition is the word scientists use to describe how materials break down in nature. Can you determine how long it takes for these littered items to decompose? Match the litter on the left with the time it can last in nature. Use the boxes on the left to write your choices. Then use the drop-down menu to check your answers.            Paper   Plastic-coated Paper   Plastic Bags   Plastic bottles   Plastic Six-pack Holder   Orange or Banana Peel   Aluminum Cans   Styrofoam   Tin Cans   Nylon Fabric   Cotton Shirt   Glass Bottles   Wool Socks   a. 2-4 weeks b. 1-6 months c. 2 years d. 1-5 years e. 5 years f. 10-20 years g. 30-40 years h. 50 years i. 80-100 years j 100 years k. 1,000,000 years l. indefinitely m. indefinitely         Answers Paper . . . . . . . . . . . .A: 2 to 4 weeks Plastic coated paper . . . . E: 5 years Plastic bags . . . . . . . . F: 10 - 20 years Plastic bottles . . . . . . .L: indefinitely Plastic 6-pack holders . . . J: 100 years Orange/banana peels . . . . .C: up to 2 years Aluminum cans . . . . . . . .I: 80 - 100 years Styrofoam . . . . . . . . . .M: indefinitely Tin cans . . . . . . . . . . H: 50 years Nylon fabric . . . . . . . . G: 30 - 40 years Cotton shirt . . . . . . . . B: 1 to 6 months Glass bottles . . . . . . . .K: 1,000,000 years Wool socks . . . . . . . . . D: 1 to 5 years        What can YOU do to help rangers keep Olympic National Park clean?
